svcsubproc.title: Driver Controls / Instrument Panel
svcsubproc.para: The driver's control panel is an ergonomically designed full function driver control system. All instruments and controls are situated to allow driver full function control with limited hands off the steering wheel at any given time. Door operation, warning light control functions and other optional items are placed in the steering wheel to allow more control for the driver.

svcsubproc.para: The steering wheel switch functions may vary based on the requirements chosen by the school district. See operators manual for actual switch function and/or location.

Steering wheel switch functions may include passenger door electric opening function, ( Fig 64, Item 7) l or cruise control on / off. The pupil warning lights may also be included in the steering wheel switch module ( Fig. 64, Item 5) or cruise control functions. The electric operated door opener has an emergency override switch located over the door entrance. An optional, manual door opener is available in place of the standard electric door control ( Fig. 109).

figure.caption: Figure 65. Driver Left Side Switch Panel

svcsubproc.para: The driver side left wing switch panel is located at the left console. This switch panel contains the controls for environmental controls, body interior light functions, electric rear view mirrors and other options.

The driver side wing storage compartment is located to the rear of the left wing switch panel. The compartment has a removable hinged top. An inside storage compartment 12 volt power supply plug with protective cap is an available option.
